name: MCSA Windows Server 2016 - 70-TBA
subtitle: Administering Windows Server 2012
description: Over 80% of computers run Microsoft Operating systems. As a result, the Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate is one of the first steps for those seeking to start a technical career. The MCSA: Windows Server covers topics that are “must know” for anyone responsible for deploying, maintaining and supporting Windows servers in a corporate or enterprise environment. Server systems often form a critical piece of the day-to-day operations for any business. The MCSA covers topics that will help the learner ensure their computing environment is functional and stable.

episodes.title: Configure Domain Controllers
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike discuss the five Operations Master Roles with Active Directory Domain Controllers; those five roles being Schema Master, Domain Naming Master, Infrastructure Master, RID Master, and PDC Emulator. Then they explain which roles fall under the Forest Wide and Domain Wide roles.

episodes.title: Configure Domain Controllers Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike continue their discussion on the Operations Master Roles; picking back up by showing you how to discover which Domain Controller has which Operation Master role. They also show you how to transfer or seize a role when necessary.

episodes.title: Configure Account Policies
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike take a look at account policies in Active Directory. They explain the difference between local vs. domain based password policies. They demonstrate common password policy settings

episodes.title: Configure Account Policies Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their discussion on account policies in Active Directory. They explain fine grain password policies and password settings objects (PSOs). They also walk through common password policy settings.

episodes.title: Group Policy Processing
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike demonstrate Group Policy processing. They look at how Group Policy Objects are processed when applied to various locations in Active Directory.

episodes.title: Group Policy Processing Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their demonstration Group Policy processing. hey explain concepts like blocking inheritance, enforcing policies and filtering GPO application by groups with security filtering.

episodes.title: Group Policy Processing Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their demonstration Group Policy processing. They explain extending filtering GPO application through Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) queries. They take a look at implementing loopback processing, client-side extension (CSE) behavior and forcing Group Policy update.

episodes.title: Group Policy Processing Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their demonstration Group Policy processing. They discuss slow-link processing, client-side extensions as well as Group Policy caching.

episodes.title: Configure Group Policy Settings
episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike describe a few of the common settings seen inside of Group Policy Management. They look at using Group Policy to deploy software to users and computers. They explain setting up folder redirection to help administrators backup user data in a centralized location.

episodes.title: Manage Group Policy Object
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike discuss and demonstrate the managing of Group Policy Objects(GPO). They explain how to backup, import, copy, and restore GPOs. They also show you how to create and configure a Migration Table as well as reset default GPOs. Finally, they look at delegating Group Policy management.

episodes.title: Configure Group Policy Preferences
episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Mike introduce you to configuring Group Policy Preferences in Windows Server 2016. They start by explaining what a Group Policy Preference is and how it differs from a Group Policy "Policy". Then they take you through some of the most commonly used settings like Printer setup, network connections, Drive mappings, and Internet Explorer settings, among others.
